newsitem.title: CHINA: China bank extends 1.0 bln yuan for sugar storage.
newsitem.headline: China bank extends 1.0 bln yuan for sugar storage.

text.p: The Guangxi branch of the Agricultural Bank of China has extended another 400 million yuan ($48.2 million) in loans to the Guangxi Sugar Co for sugar storage, the Financial News said on Friday.
It was the second batch of loans extended by the bank in the southwestern sugar-growing region to the firm this year, it said.
The two batches of loans totalled 1.0 billion yuan and could be used to purchase and store 250,000 tonnes of sugar, it said.
The loans would play an important role in boosting farmers' enthusiasm for planting sugarcane and easing fund shortages for sugar processors, the newspaper quoted branch chief Li Yanbin as saying.
China produced 4.6381 million tonnes of sugar in the first five months of the year, up 13.2 percent from the same period of 1996.
China produced 95,000 tonnes of sugar in May alone.
China's sugar crushing season is from October to April.
